paper_title.en: Proposal of computer aided design and simulation system for conceptual design of environmentally conscious product

publication_name.en: TOOLS AND METHODS OF COMPETITIVE ENGINEERING Vols 1 and 2

paper_title.en: Proposal of environmentally conscious ceramics products from point of view of industrial design

description.en: Today, the modern ceramic products which are useful for modern industrial production are produced. The modern ceramic products have the potential for the material alteration to steel and plastic. We propose the potential manufacturing processes for creating the new environmentally conscious product which is made with the new ceramic material. And we propose the industrial design of the new ceramics product (ceramics personal computer) which is made with the new ceramic material by the proposed manufacturing processes. We indicate the changes of product, life cycle by the new environmentally conscious ceramics product from the point of view of design manufacturing and recycling.

paper_title.en: Density spatial model for computer aided industrial design

publication_name.en: GEOMETRIC MODELLING

paper_title.en: The Automated Process Planning for Sheet Metal Bending by Handling Robot

description.en: In the present study, a method is proposed which generates process planning of sheet metal bending by robot. In bending process, the handling operation of sheet metal parts has been performed by human experts. In case of human worker, the main purpose of process planning is to determine the bending sequence and tools used. If handling operations are replaced to robot, the grasping position and reposition of sheet metal parts must be indicated in detail as well as the bending sequence and tools. In this paper, the problem of constraints for bending sequence is solved by using a connectivity graph which consists of bend lines and faces. And the graph is made for each grasping position. The bending sequence which contains some geometrical bending features are determined on basis of channel feature. As a result, searching space of bending sequences is reduced and feasible bending sequences can be obtained by taking the grasping positions into consideration. A computer simulation was performed based on the proposed method, and bending sequences with grasping positions and reposition are determined and sorted in order of the number of repositions. Illustrative examples and results of various simulation models are given and the effectiveness of this method is discussed. © 2000, The Japan Society of Mechanical Engineers. All rights reserved.

publication_name.en: Nihon Kikai Gakkai Ronbunshu, C Hen/Transactions of the Japan Society of Mechanical Engineers, Part C

paper_title.en: Product shape creation process of industrial design expressed by extended image movement model

description.en: Image effects carry out important roles in human creative thinking process. U. Neisser uses the term "image (schema)" to indicate the dynamic structure for extracting the information from the environment. We proposed Image movement model, which expressed idea development process of product shape in industrial design from point of view of image (schema), We propose the extended Image movement model which expresses image growth and image envisioning processes of industrial design by chaotic dynamics system. The chaotic orbits, which generate in a phase space express growth of image (scheme). As an estimation criterion of creativity of product shape image, we propose Kolmogorov entropy, which indicates the change of the amount of information in chaotic dynamics system.

publisher.en: UNIV ZAGREB, FACULTY MECHANICAL ENGINEERING & NAVAL ARCHITECTURE

publication_name.en: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 6TH INTERNATIONAL DESIGN CONFERENCE: DESIGN 2000

paper_title.en: Machine recognition of human task for man-machine cooperative work

description.en: Because recent products are becoming too complex to operate or maintain them by only one worker without special education, an associate system, which advises the worker how to do, is required. In order to construct the associate system, an recognition method for monitoring human task and motion by using HMM and AND/OR graph is proposed. An experimental system is developed, in which a vision device and a force sensing device are used for detecting human motions. As the results of the recognition tests for assembly and disassembly works, we found the system can identify the task about 90% correctly. We confirmed the system can contribute to the man-machine cooperative work.

publication_name.en: Proceedings of the IEEE International Conference on Systems, Man and Cybernetics

paper_title.en: Collaborative design conception with functional elements' approach

description.en: The searching of suitable data input for a description of the mechanical assemblies (MA) and the information exchange on standardized way are worldwide problems. The separate design tasks (preparation of specification, assembly and parts' drafting, assembly planning, dimensional-tolerance analysis and etc.) are usually solved without an appropriate united medium model of the MA. For this objective, an approach with functional elements (FE) was proposed. FE are basic design objects which contain information about mechanical joints and working surfaces of the MA. A collaborative design (CD) conception based on the functional (with FE) description of MA is proposed. A scheme of the organization and relations of the main modules for functional description, geometrical composition, analysis and documentation is presented. The formulation of new contents of the catalogue (a principal format of FE data) and its use as information generative exchanging tool is presented.

publication_name.en: Proceedings of the IEEE International Conference on Systems, Man and Cybernetics

paper_title.en: Geometric model based displacement analysis system of mechanisms

description.en: This paper deals with a software system for the displacement analysis of arbitrary mechanisms, which has been discussed by many researchers. However, concerning the topological analysis of a mechanism and the automated generation of joint information, several problems remain unsolved. We propose more general methods than those previously reported in order to handle spatial constraints involving higher pairs by using solid models and to analyze the structure of the mechanism by considering the directions of multiple closed loops. Furthermore, the technique of mathematical programming is applied to the displacement analysis. The practical applicability of the developed system with the methods described in this paper is demonstrated through several examples.

publication_name.en: JSME INTERNATIONAL JOURNAL SERIES C-MECHANICAL SYSTEMS MACHINE ELEMENTS AND MANUFACTURING

paper_title.en: Tool operation based operation force teaching: Extracting force control strategy from human's work in virtual environment

description.en: This paper deals with a virtual environment which is used for extracting expert's knowledge of work and transferring the work information to a worker. The worker is either a human or a robot. Tool based work representation is convenient for both human and robots to use the data. Tool operation is also convenient to construct a force feedback system in a virtual environment. The data recorded in the virtual environment is saved as work examples in a database, and used by a worker when he wants to refer to the samples. In the virtual environment an expert shows what he wants to do. It's not important to get a detail amount of data. The most important objective of the virtual environment is to get the expert's knowledge on the work through the force. In this paper we propose a new virtual environment which is based on qualitative simulation. We call it Virtual Mental Space (VMS) because human mental models are said to be qualitative models about the physical world. Interactions between a human and the VMS provides explanations of what he wants to do, and make it possible to get a force which he wants to stress. The tool operation is used conveniently again to smooth the interaction.

publication_name.en: Proceedings of the ASME Design Engineering Technical Conference

paper_title.en: Disassembly path generation to verify the assemblability of mechanical products

description.en: A system for verifying assemblability is required in CAD/CAM systems for mechanical products, by which the shapes of parts can be modified to enable easy machining and assembly on the factory floor. This paper introduces a part assemblability verification system. Substituting the assemblability with disassemblability, a system that generates paths for disassembly is constructed based on a solid modeling system for mechanical products. The developed system takes contact constraint and contact transition into consideration. Algorithms to derive possible motions of parts which maintain contact states, and to calculate the positions and orientations (configurations) where contact states change are presented. An assemblability verifying method is proposed that uses tree structural data whose arcs and nodes denote possible motions, configurations respectively. The efficiency of the developed system for design verification and assembly planning is demonstrated through an example.

publisher.en: JAPAN SOC MECHANICAL ENGINEERS SANSHIN HOKUSEI BLDG

publication_name.en: JSME INTERNATIONAL JOURNAL SERIES C-DYNAMICS CONTROL ROBOTICS DESIGN AND MANUFACTURING

paper_title.en: Kinematic simulation using qualitative mechanism models

description.en: When trying to use computers to aid designers at the conceptual design stage, it becomes clear that many traditional methods and support tools are incompetent because they mainly deal with sufficient and quantitative information. However, at the conceptual design stage, information is insufficient and mostly qualitative. The focus of this paper is on representing and reasoning about the geometry and motion of physical objects for mechanical conceptual design. A new concept, called qualitative spatial relation space (QSRS), is introduced to describe mechanisms of mechanical products by referring to the qualitative spatial relations between their components. A qualitative kinematic simulation system has been implemented to enable verification of functions of products at the conceptual design stage. The system derives motions of components caused by other components' specified motions from the qualitative structural descriptions of products, and puts brief and comprehensible functional interpretations of products.

publication_name.en: Human interface

paper_title.ja: 2204 アイジェスチャによる計算機入力装置の評価
paper_title.en: Evaluation of Computer Interface Device with Eye-Gesture

description.ja: As a computer input method without hands, eye motion is a considerable choice. We call it eye gesture and we have developed a computer interaction device in witch a user inputs command by using the eye motion with viewing graphical information on computer display. Since the developed device has a CCD camera to get image of user's eye and a high performance image processor, the device detects both pupil position and eyelid motion at a time. In this paper, the eyelid opening motion is tried to use as a new eye gesture sign. Experimental results show that the eyelid opening motion is a reliable sign to express user's intention but it disturbs the eye pointing motion.
description.en: As a computer input method without hands, eye motion is a considerable choice. We call it eye gesture and we have developed a computer interaction device in witch a user inputs command by using the eye motion with viewing graphical information on computer display. Since the developed device has a CCD camera to get image of user's eye and a high performance image processor, the device detects both pupil position and eyelid motion at a time. In this paper, the eyelid opening motion is tried to use as a new eye gesture sign. Experimental results show that the eyelid opening motion is a reliable sign to express user's intention but it disturbs the eye pointing motion.

paper_title.ja: 2311 リアルとデジタルモックアップ対比による CAD 教育システムの設計
paper_title.en: Design of CAD Education System in Comparison between Real and Digital Mockup

description.ja: Engineering education is being recognized to be more important to maintain high position in Japanese technology advantage. However, the technology detachment becomes serious among young people. In order to avoid such circumstances, appropriate engineering education systems are being searched. We are designing a CAD/CAE education system with an attempt of combining real and digital mockup concept into an exercising schooling. As a background, we have introduced a new CAD/CAE system including solid modeler (SolidWorks), structure analysis with FEM (DesignSpace) and mechanical analysis system (DDM) for every student. After learning the operation with exercises for 1.5 years, this final exercising lessons are to be learned. As a real product base, we choose LEGO block. The aim of this exercise is to make the student to know the importance of real and digital consideration for any mechanical design.
description.en: Engineering education is being recognized to be more important to maintain high position in Japanese technology advantage. After learning the operation with exercises for 1.5 years, this final exercising lessons are to be learned. As a real product base, we choose LEGO block. The aim of this exercise is to make the student to know the importance of real and digital consideration for any mechanical design.

publication_name.en: JSME et al. Proceedings of the 9<sup>th</sup> Design Symposium

paper_title.en: Determination of operation sequences with minimum tool-changes in mechanical machining

description.en: In the manufacturing process of a mechanical part, many operations with alternatives can be generated. A method for selecting optimum operations from the alternatives, and then sequencing them in order to satisfy some objectives such as the lowest cost or minimum time, is required. This paper proposes a new method for determining operation sequences that minimize the number of tool-changes. First, sub-sets of operations, in each of which operations can be consecutively executed by one tool are determined from the information on tools, and the precedence constraints of operations. Based on the sub-sets of the operations, an integer programming problem is introduced next to determine the operation sequences that minimize the number of tool-changes. Finally, the effectiveness of the method is clarified through a case study.
